paragraphs.text: Obama's State of the Union fantasy world: We need a real national security strategy, VA reform.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: Here's a prediction: expect a narrative to emerge in certain media outlets in the coming days that Tuesday night's State of the Union speech was a grand return to form for President Obama
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The elite, east-coast intelligencia line will be that the beleaguered lame duck president--facing a hostile, conservative Congress--regained his momentum with renewed energy and purpose
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: How Obama Got His Groove Back
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Washington- style
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Groove aside
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the fact remains that Obama's next-to-last State of the Union address did not substantially address two of the most pressing issues currently facing our nation and that matter most to its military veterans: the lack of a clear United States national security strategy-- to include the crisis facing our military-- and the inability of the VA bureaucracy care to deliver timely health care to millions of our veterans
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But you wouldn't know it by listening to Tuesday night's State of the Union address
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: President Obama is living in a fantasy world
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The president says that we're "stopping ISIL's advance."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: But
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: in reality, his campaign of airstrikes have not been successful
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: ISIS controls more territory in Iraq and Syria today than ever before
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: He also boldly claimed that "we're slashing the backlog that had too many veterans waiting years to get the benefits they need,"
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: this statement too just doesn't match up with reality
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Today, nearly 250,000 veterans are still stuck in the VA claims backlog and another 290,000 languish in the appeals process
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: Is that still "too many," Mr  President?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Unfortunate events will likely force the president's attention to these issues in 2015
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: just like
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: ISIS did in Iraq and Phoenix did for the VA in 2014
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: However
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: President Obama could be proactive and get ahead of these issues by pursuing the following four agenda items
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Articulate a real national security strategy
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The president's plan for"leading from behind"-- and that national security and foreign policy boils down to "don't do stupid stuff"-- is no substitute for a real strategy, as deteriorating situations in Iraq, Syria, Libya, Ukraine and elsewhere prove
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Likewise, denying the nature of the enemy we face("ISIS is not Islamic") only muddies the water further
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: emboldening our enemies and confusing our allies
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: President Obama also touted ending the 14 year-long war in Afghanistan
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: "ending" is different than"winning."
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: His telegraphed withdrawals have pulled us out of conflicts before they're resolved
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: creating power vacuums in Iraq- and soon in Afghanistan- that leave America more vulnerable
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And incredibly, for the first time since 9/11, the president failed to even mention the Taliban or Al Qaeda
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: both of which are far from "on the run" as he proclaimed in 2012 and are advancing and actively challenging the West
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Get serious about fixing defense spending
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Instead of cutting fat, the president's ill-conceived defense budget sequester has slashed into the muscle of our military force
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The administration should strive to replace defense sequestration, by implementing serious and commensurate acquisitions and compensation reforms
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Reforming these areas will reduce Pentagon budgetary pressures caused by massive weapons system cost-overruns and exploding personnel costs, allowing for a more strategic allocation of war-fighting resources
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In order to live within a fiscally responsible reality, and most importantly maintain the world's most capable military, the administration and Congress must get serious about real DoD spending reform
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: His address last night didn't even mention sequestration
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Develop and implement a plan to tackle the national debt
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Respected military leaders like Marine General James Mattis, Admiral Mike Mullen, and many others recognize that the biggest long-term threat to our national security is our massive national debt
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: At more than $18 trillion and growing, the debt is on track to double under President Obama
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It is absolutely vital to the fiscal, economic, and military strength of our country that we have a serious plan to get our debt under control through reductions in spending and significant reforms across the government
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Implement more accountability and choice at the VA
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The VA reforms passed by Congress last year were a good first step, but will not address the deeper, systemic culture problems at VA
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In the next Congress, the president should champion even deeper reforms at VA to bring accountability for poor performing employees throughout the department and to expand health care options for veterans outside the VA system
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: These basic principles would not only address a campaign promise the president has failed to deliver on("fixing the VA") but would show that he is finally serious about improving veterans' access to the quality health care they earned
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: What the president misses, and even defies, in his latest list of proposals is that Americans don't think government isn't doing enough
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: They think government does too much, that most of what it does, it does poorly
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: that it doesn't attend to the issues that matter to them
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Focusing on the four agenda items above would send a message that the president is finally serious about governing in his last two years in office
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It's probably too much to ask for Obama to change his approach at this stage in his presidency
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it's essential if he wants to avoid a legacy of division, defiance and neglect
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: if
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the president continues on his current course?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Well, the items listed above will become part of a compelling agenda for his potential successors
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: as
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: they take to the campaign trail for 2016
paragraphs.label: assumption
